cisc3120.asteroids

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • cisc3120.asteroids.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Asteroids

     class Game
extends java.awt.Canvas
    A painted canvas in its own window, updated every 0.01 second. This class sets up the basic logic for a "game canvas" on which the game objects will be displayed and moved.

    NOTE: You should not change any code in this class. You don't need to understand it at this point, though studying it is a good idea.

    Author:
    Scott Dexter

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String name,
    int inWidth,
    int inHeight)
        Creates the game canvas. The canvas is a labeled window of the given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        name - String used to label the game window
        inWidth - Width of the game canvas
        inHeight - Height of the game canvas

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(java.awt.Graphics brush)
        Where the 'magic' happens. Paints a buffer to the screen, then waits a hundredth of a second before repeating itself.
        Overrides:
        update in class java.awt.Canvas
        See Also:
        Canvas.update(java.awt.Graphics)
